intro: Erigeron multiflorus, commonly known as the common blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Erigeron multiflorus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
